meanings.definition: relating to the maintenance of health and the treatment of disease by varying the concentrations in the body of substances that are normally present in the body
meanings.sent1: The doctor recommended an orthomolecular approach to improve my health.
meanings.sent2: She believes in the benefits of orthomolecular therapy for overall well-being.
meanings.sent3: Trying an orthomolecular diet might be just the boost my body needs.
meanings.sent4: His orthomolecular treatment plan was like a tailored suit for his health issues.
meanings.sent5: The concept of orthomolecular medicine is like a puzzle piece fitting perfectly into place.

meanings.definition: of, relating to, or being a theory holding that mental diseases or abnormalities result from various chemical imbalances or deficiencies and can be treated by introducing into the body substances naturally present in the body
meanings.sent1: The psychiatrist suggested an orthomolecular approach to address the chemical imbalances.
meanings.sent2: The orthomolecular perspective on mental health is gaining recognition.
meanings.sent3: Using orthomolecular principles in psychology is a fascinating idea.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt like an orthomolecular equation waiting to be balanced.
meanings.sent5: The idea of orthomolecular psychiatry is as refreshing as a cool breeze on a hot day.
